intro: Siphocampylus hypopogon, commonly known as the narrowleaf lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of pink to purple flowers. Its botanical features reflect adaptations to its harsh environment, including reduced leaf size and specialized root structures for nutrient absorption.
